author: dwayne
title: DAO-NET: SPO DAO
description: O DAO Net procura manter um valor mínimo para as fichas DAO, utilizando taxas babel, porém são necessários incentivos para que as SPO ofereçam este serviço.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is a great and complex implementation that could improve adoption and usability on cardano blockchain for SPOs and delegators, because SPO business model revenue is a huge pain on Cardano blockchain. The proposal articulates how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem and for the stakeholders (in deep detail for SPO's, users, professional and so on.. ).
As a SPO I think that any Cardano SPOs sees value on this proposal.
At the same time the statement of how problem is to be solved is well being specified with implementation and with revenue model, definition of success that support economic model.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer team is very well skilled about the whole context and, knows the Cardano community very well because they work as developers and there is a functional pilot (https://github.com/DAO-NET-Developer-Platform).
The scope of the solution is well explained (e.g. how the funds will be spent, what features will be implemented, and so on…).
In my opinion (I'm 20 years experienced senior information manager on financial sectors) the budget requested is coherent with the elapsed.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer provides a step-by-step plan for the implementation with clear milestones, with  KPI metrics that are shown. It's good that is that the proposer has briefly mentioned possible difficulties and how to deal with them (e.g. competitors, delay,…) The proposal offers a realistic timetable to complete the work and coherent budget with this challenge.
Furthermore the proposer has very well mentioned possible difficulties and how to deal with them (e.g. difficulties in market adoption, revenue model for cardano ecosystem and SPOs.

f6_assessments.q0: This is quite an ambitious project which could attract new capital to SPOs as well as new projects which would be funded through this proposal. The idea of local communities voting for the things they care about is exciting and inclusive.
f6_assessments.q1: Given the fact that the team is small, will hire new people after funding, and their past experience in blockchain tech seems to be superficial-to-somewhat-technical it remains to be seen how they will manage to launch a production-ready product in 6 months and then get enough people and their funds within the next 6 months to be able to get one funded and implemented SPO business idea.
f6_assessments.q2: They have already made a boilerplate github repository for their project which indicates they will open-source their solution, however who they hire may or may not be fully transparent to the public. Overall the progress of the project will be auditable.

f6_assessments.q0: Babel fees as an added service for SPOs is definitely an impactful use case, and if in addition the proposing team is aiming to work with and reach out to single stake pool operators, this is a win-win proposal tackling 2 important aspects of Cardano' ecosystem in my opinion, given though it'll not only promote and facilitate an SPOs use case (babbel fees services) but also it'll promote network optimal decentralization (which is a must-focus on for Cardano's future development and healthy network growth)
f6_assessments.q1:
Detail plans are well described, and it seems as the team have put a good amount of work thinking about the proposal, by analizing the possible opportunities/risks of the project, and going for a multi-proposal focus that also takes into account the risks and possible ways to continue with its development in case some proposal doesn't get funded.
Team expertise and backgrounds seems qualified enough, but 2 critical roles of the proposal are not already onboarded. As they've mentioned, they've though about their primary roles and profiles, but it's still something that makes me give it 4 stars instead of 5, since we don't know the whole team and their background.
Besides that, the proposal seems to have a clear roadmap to achieve success.
Also, it seems as Project Manager's budget it's kind of low in my opinion (only 500 USD x month) in comparison with other Catalyst's proposals. It might be a part-time job for him, although it's not specified into the proposal I think.
f6_assessments.q2: There's a clear roadmap throughout a six-month period, success definition throughout 3-6-12month period, and KPIs put into place to sufficiently achieve the progress and success of this proposal.

solution: Criar DAO para Operadores de Pool de Estacas que fornecerão incentivos de financiamento para aqueles dispostos a fornecer serviços de taxa babel.
experience: Uma equipe experiente de desenvolvedores Blockchain, pioneiros de Plutus, operadores de SPO, Conselheiros Comunitários e Analistas de Soluções.
